rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language ('No human cases have been documented', 'only one has been reported').
The segment uses 'have been documented' and 'has been reported', not moderate verbs indicating impact/scale.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
Reports bare positive facts ('No human cases have been documented', 'only one has been reported') without explicit calming language.
'only one' has minimiser but lacks explicit contrasting scale.
'No human cases have been documented' is a bare negation (evidence negation) without an explicit calming cue.
